guidingQuestions: Why did you choose this book?
Is this book easy, just right or challenging? How do you know?
Tell me what this book is about so far.
Is this book what you expected it to be about?
Does your mind ever wander when you are reading? If so, what do you do?
What connection can you make between this book and your own life?
What do you wonder about this book?
Can you relate to any of the characters? If so, in what ways?
Have any questions come up as you have been reading?
What word or phrase would you use to describe this book? Why?
What's the most interesting thing so far in your book?
Would you recommend this book to a friend? Why or why not?
Are there any confusing parts in the book? Why are they confusing?
Summarize what you have read so far.
What do you think would be the best ending for this book?
speakingNotes: Adapts speech to formal / informal contexts
Speaks at an appropriate pace, volume
Forms and uses verb tenses correctly
Makes grammatical errors with verbs or pronouns
